officer as of April 4, handing the reins to Google co-founder Larry Page, who will become the central figure in day-to-day operations. Mr. Eric Schmidt will take the title of executive chairman, which entails a focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Perhaps the most important aspect of Mr. Eric Schmidt 's new job will be keeping government bodies at bay, as Google's dominance attracts more attention from regulatory authorities.
